page.title: 02BRADNOP'S RAILWAY.
page.content: The Cauldon Low to Leekbrook railway was opened on June 15th 1905 by the first train from Leek at 8.05am. There were once regular passenger trains from Leek station to Waterhouses.The train used to slow down outside Thors cave so people could see it properly. Now the railway track is used only for Cauldon Low quarrys purpose carrying stone through Leek and on through Endon towards Stoke. The track runs alongside the main A523 all the way through the Bradnop area. Bradnop station is now is now almost disappeared now through deriliction, there is only a small piece of platform left now.It is opposite what is now a coal store.It was burnt down in 1928 but was rebuilt again. Local people get used to the noise after a while.
